dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c KOA Powell b Bishoo 103 (124b 7x4 2x6) SR: 83.06

dismissalComment.html: taken by square leg diving to his right! Full on middle, and Tamim tries to slog sweep behind square. Whips this away off his legs, but the ball doesn't get the elevation, and this time Tamim must walk back

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah not out 67 (49b 5x4 3x6) SR: 136.73

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: top edge to deep square. It was coming. They were both getting restless, and it's Shakib who goes first. Length ball looped right up at middle stump. Looks to go for the big slog sweep and ends up getting a top-edge. It's how you got the oversized slogger out at high school level - toss it right up. Shakib, among the elite allrounders in the world, will not be happy with that

got him! Mushfiqur was trying to do too much there. Short on middle, and Mushfiqur went down on one knee - outside off stump - to try and scoop it over fine leg. But he misses his swipe, and the ball turns away from him and crashes into leg stump. Soft, soft dismissal

taken at mid-on. Anamul's struggle ends. It's a a short ball rising steeply in the corridor and an ordinary attempt to hook. He's caught on the front foot and is completely cramped. Drags it into the hands of mid-on off the high part of the bat
glanced straight to short third man! Mortaza was making room and Holder followed him. He tries to ramp this short ball over the infield, but the shot doesn't come off the bat's sweet spot

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

Shakib, among the elite allrounders in the world, will not be happy with that

dismissalComment.html: got him! Mushfiqur was trying to do too much there. Short on middle, and Mushfiqur went down on one knee - outside off stump - to try and scoop it over fine leg. But he misses his swipe, and the ball turns away from him and crashes into leg stump. Soft, soft dismissal

dismissalComment.html: full outside off, and his attempted slog doesn't come off. Slices this shot, and Lewis takes this skyer at point

headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rovman Powell not out 74 (41b 5x4 4x6) SR: 180.48

headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Rubel Hossain 73 (66b 6x4 5x6) SR: 110.6

dismissalComment.html: full on middle, and this time it's in Gayle's arc. He smashes over Rubel's head, but straight to long on! The Bangladesh team celebrate like they've won the World Cup!

headshotImage.caption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken. Mashrafe persists and he gets his man. Lewis has been bottled up by Bangladesh's captain and it's him who gets the breakthrough eventually. Offcutter climbs in the corridor. It's at a good length but he's stabbing at it off the back foot. Flies high to the keeper's left and he takes it easily

image.longCaption: Shai Hope player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: holes out at deep midwicket! Shakib gets under this, and finally Bangladesh hold onto a catch. The offcutter from Mashrafe enticed Hope to go for a big shot, but the slog is not timed well enough

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: crashes into leg stump! Gets the big, big wicket of Shimron. It's a flat ball that lands on middle, and sneaks under his bat as he tries to pull to the leg side. The ball skids through after pitching, and that quicker delivery is just too much for Hetmyer to handle. He's gotta go

dismissalText.commentary: Kieran Powell run out (Mashrafe Mortaza/Mehidy Hasan Miraz) 4 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: full just outside off, and Hope drives to cover. But this time Powell is already halfway down the wicket with Hope still at the keeper's end. No chance of a single, as Mashrafe collects, lobs the ball to Mehidy, and he wastes no time in whipping the bails off

dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder c Rubel Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman 9 (10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: full on middle, and he goes for the big shot over extra cover. Can't time it well, and the ball is in the air for ages. Rubel gets under it at long off and does manage to hold on! Sends Holder home.

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full on off, and Nurse brings out a front foot defence to end the series.Bangladesh win by 18 runs!

commentPostTextItems.html: 5.54pm That's all from us at ESPNcricinfo. Time to say goodbye, but don't forget to join us for the T20I series. Till then, on behalf of everyone here, this is Sreshth Shah signing off. Good bye!
5.44pm Time for the presentation.

Jason Holder, the losing captain: "We struggled to put together a complete game. 300 was a par score here, and the bowlers did pretty well, but we didn't bat in the middle overs. We lost momentum in the middle, but credit to Gayle and Rovman for giving us a chance, but we just weren't able to tick over the scoreboard. Credit also goes to Bangladesh. These days 300 is a par score, and we should've chased it down. Got a lot of work to do before the World Cup, but Hetmyer played well, Keemo came into his own, Chris was amazing and Rovman has been doing well. So a couple of positives."

Tamim Iqbal, the Man of the Match and the Man of the Series, says: "We didn't have a great Test series, so we practiced a lot. But this is a format we are comfortable in. What I wanted to do was bat long, my team asked me to bat long, so I did it successfully. The wicket in West Indies is never easy, but you have to be patient here. Patience is the key and that's why I got the big runs.

Mashrafe Mortaza, the winning captain: "Cricket is a mental game. But boys stepped up from the first ODI itself, but we played well for the most part of the game even when we lost in match 2. Boys are in good touch so the juniors need to step up too. Bowlers were good in all three games, and now we need to start the T20s confidently. West Indies are a great T20I team."

Tasmeem: "The key thing for Bangladesh was that they had just a really slow innings, but sadly West Indies had two. Also the last 15 overs made the difference. Shai Hope was really slow, but the stat shows it's nothing new. May be the situation demanded a promotion for Rovman Powell and Holder, just like Mashrafe promoted himself."

Hridoy : "Congratulations to BD tigers to win the series. Got some price for the sacrifice of sleepless nights. Let's time for some peaceful sleep. R Powell almost take my sleep but that was an awesome knock!!!!"
Salim: "@Belal True. No consistent new players emerging to replace the seniors. All are hit or miss. Soumya. Shabbir, Anamul, Mosaddek, Mominul, just not cutting it. "

Jahan: "Let's not put the blame on Hope. What about Lewis' slow start. Or the lack of death bowling for WI in the first innings? All factors should be taken into consideration, not just the obvious. There are positives and negatives both sides can take going into the t20's"
rabbul: "my man of the match is RUbel as he has habituated to give away 22 to 25 runs in penaltimate over but today gave away only 6 :)"

Belal: "Phew! Got some dignity back. But we lost badly against Afghanistan in T20s and WI in tests. I fear for our team in the future, our mentality is not right. The seniors not interested in test cricket, makes me so badly upset. We won matches against Australia and England that gave me so much joy but then Sri Lanka beat us at home. Where are we going with this team."

5.28pm The two captains now shake hands. West Indies played the series in a great spirit too. No shame in losing a closely-fought series. Rovman Powell pushed hard after Chris Gayle's fifty gave the hosts a good start. But a couple of slow batting performances in the middle-overs made things just too tough for Windies to forge a comeback. The visitors win 2-1, and we'll be back soon with the presentation party.
Sulaiman: "Brisk 70 at the top and brisk 70 at the end it means t was Hope who lost the game for WI"
yanthan: "when 4 of the top 5 scores less than 72 SR while chasing more than 6 RPO this is simply unacceptable. WI must learn to play more aggressive if want to be more competitive during WC19."

Sneh : "Great game of cricket.. Fantastic series win for BD..need to mention about Powell's marvelous inning as well..he certainly deserves to bat one or two position higher in this lineup..Well contested series it was..!"

Rakesh Sampat: "Bangladesh were 259 and WI 262 at the end of the 47th over and it's the last 3 overs that the WI bowler's bowled with so much casualness that has come back to haunt them in the end and also Lewis forgetting that he was in a ODI and not a test match"

Naseef : "Watching the game with sleepy eyes now!! I must say it was worth that!! What a match!! Some sheer power hitting from Rovman Powell almost took my sleep away!! I'll sleep peacefully now!! Goodnight!!"

5.25 pm Celebrations in Basseterre as Mehidy, Mahmudullah and Mortaza high-five each other. First series win for Bangladesh outside Asia since 2009. Smiles all around. The camera stays on Mashrafe Mortaza, who starred with the bat late in the innings and then led with the ball as well. Kudos to Shakib, Mehidy, Rubel and Mustafizur as well for their control.

commentPreTextItems.html: Bangladesh fans celebrating in the stands.

commentTextItems.html: back of a length outside leg, and he flicks it square to deep midwicket

commentPostTextItems.html: Nitin Jain: "A well fought series. Kudos to the Bangla Tigers, they did play exceedingly well. "

commentTextItems.html: good length outside off, and he backs away before cutting to Rubel at cover point. Rubel cartwheels and stops a certain boundary!
full outside leg stump, and Nurse's wild swing doesn't make contact with the ball. It goes through to the keeper and now the equation becomes seven runs per ball.
good length on leg stump, and the pull goes to deep midwicket. No chance of a double. Gets Nurse on strike

commentPostTextItems.html: MahneelMusa: "This is exactly what I meant when i said Rubel is beyond his stats and numbers!"

commentPreTextItems.html: West Indies need 28. Powell on strike. You know it's possible.

commentTextItems.html: over wide long on! Make that 22 off five! Full on off, and lifted into the stands. In his arc, and Powell doesn't miss out
full on off, and Powell can't put this away! It was in the slot to be thumped, but the ball takes an inside edge to the leg side. Powell is disappointed, but atleast he keeps strike

commentPostTextItems.html: Harun: "Great job By RUBEL"

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: attempted yorker on off stump, and all Nurse can do is thump a drive down to long on

commentPostTextItems.html: Mashrafe comes to have a chat with Rubel before the final ball. Once again, can he finish the over well?

commentPreTextItems.html: Tanzin: "Rubel in 49th over again!!! Mash got some guts I must say. " -- Three balls to go.

commentTextItems.html: full outside off, and the slog takes the bat's inside edge! Almost beats the keeper, but Mushfiqur sticks his left hand out and stops the ball. Saves a certain four
yorker on off, and shoveled to cover. Just a single
knee-high full toss but wide outside off. He swings across the line, and gets a good connection too, but the shot goes to long on on the bounce

commentPreTextItems.html: West Indies need 34 off 12. Here's Rubel.

commentTextItems.html: full outside off, and the drive is drilled to the fielder at cover. All the infielders are on the 30-yard circle

good length on leg stump, and Powell misses the leg-side swipe. Hits his front pad, and the lbw appeal is turned down! Looked much closer, but maybe the height saved him. A chance of a run-out as well, as Mushfiqur has a shy at the stumps with Powell outside his crease. But he misses.

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full outside leg stump, and he misses the paddle sweep. Hits the bat's handle and flies away to the off side instead. They appeal for lbw, but the umpire signals runs
good length ball outside leg stump, and Powell flicks this off his pads to the leg side

commentPreTextItems.html: Harun: "What a Fantastic game, even I'm a Bangladeshi I have no problem who even win the match;;;; Good luck tigers"

commentTextItems.html: lucky! An excellent delivery that costs Fizz a boundary. Back of a length outside leg, and Powell tried to nudge it to the leg side. Takes a leading edge, and flies between keeper and gully!
full on middle, and defended back to Fizz off the front foot

commentPostTextItems.html: Anupam Raj: "@Sneh.. yes bro.. only positive outcome was it gave us our Dada back.. not in blues but in whites.. the beauty of this game.. how a second of brilliance can change course of a story."

dismissalText.long: c Rubel Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder c Rubel Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman 9 (10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 90

commentPreTextItems.html: Fizz with the ball now. Tense faces everywhere as long as Powell and Holder are in the middle.

commentTextItems.html: full on middle, and he goes for the big shot over extra cover. Can't time it well, and the ball is in the air for ages. Rubel gets under it at long off and does manage to hold on! Sends Holder home.

commentPostTextItems.html: Sashi Kurucheti: "How can that not be a boundary? Ridiculous! Bowlers and batsmen cannot cross their lines but the fielders can push their??!" -- The umpires did check whether the ball crossed the original boundary line. They deemed that it didn't. Pretty much the end of story thus. At this stage it doesn't matter what we think. Better for WI to move on and look to chase the total down anyway
Deepak: "Uhhh this frustrates me so much, this happened with a debate over a boundary Dhawan in Ct13 final, it's also the foot that's over where the boundary line was when he picks and throws."
Hasan: "Deja vu for Bangladesh! Another Nidahas Trophy final in the making."

commentTextItems.html: full on leg, and Holder's slog is mistimed to deep backward square leg. Eleven off the over

commentPostTextItems.html: West Indies need 40 off 18.

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full and wide outside off. Holder does well to let it go through. One free run for West Indies

dismissalComment.html: glanced straight to short third man! Mortaza was making room and Holder followed him. He tries to ramp this short ball over the infield, but the shot doesn't come off the bat's sweet spot

headshotImage.longCaption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Lewis b Cottrell 12 (9b 2x4 0x6) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: full outside off, and his attempted slog doesn't come off. Slices this shot, and Lewis takes this skyer at point

dismissalComment.html: full outside off, and his attempted slog doesn't come off. Slices this shot, and Lewis takes this skyer at point

taken at mid-on. Anamul's struggle ends. It's a a short ball rising steeply in the corridor and an ordinary attempt to hook. He's caught on the front foot and is completely cramped. Drags it into the hands of mid-on off the high part of the bat
glanced straight to short third man! Mortaza was making room and Holder followed him. He tries to ramp this short ball over the infield, but the shot doesn't come off the bat's sweet spot

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken by square leg diving to his right! Full on middle, and Tamim tries to slog sweep behind square. Whips this away off his legs, but the ball doesn't get the elevation, and this time Tamim must walk back

headshotImage.caption: Keemo Paul, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Keemo Paul, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: top edge to deep square. It was coming. They were both getting restless, and it's Shakib who goes first. Length ball looped right up at middle stump. Looks to go for the big slog sweep and ends up getting a top-edge. It's how you got the oversized slogger out at high school level - toss it right up. Shakib, among the elite allrounders in the world, will not be happy with that

got him! Mushfiqur was trying to do too much there. Short on middle, and Mushfiqur went down on one knee - outside off stump - to try and scoop it over fine leg. But he misses his swipe, and the ball turns away from him and crashes into leg stump. Soft, soft dismissal

Shakib, among the elite allrounders in the world, will not be happy with that

headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Rubel Hossain 73 (66b 6x4 5x6) SR: 110.6

dismissalComment.html: full on middle, and this time it's in Gayle's arc. He smashes over Rubel's head, but straight to long on! The Bangladesh team celebrate like they've won the World Cup!

headshotImage.caption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Evin Lewis c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 13 (33b 1x4 0x6) SR: 39.39

dismissalComment.html: taken. Mashrafe persists and he gets his man. Lewis has been bottled up by Bangladesh's captain and it's him who gets the breakthrough eventually. Offcutter climbs in the corridor. It's at a good length but he's stabbing at it off the back foot. Flies high to the keeper's left and he takes it easily

image.longCaption: Shai Hope player portrait, West Indies media day

image.longCaption: Shai Hope player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Shai Hope c Shakib Al Hasan b Mashrafe Mortaza 64 (94b 5x4 0x6) SR: 68.08

dismissalComment.html: holes out at deep midwicket! Shakib gets under this, and finally Bangladesh hold onto a catch. The offcutter from Mashrafe enticed Hope to go for a big shot, but the slog is not timed well enough

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shimron Hetmyer b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 30 (42b 2x4 0x6) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: crashes into leg stump! Gets the big, big wicket of Shimron. It's a flat ball that lands on middle, and sneaks under his bat as he tries to pull to the leg side. The ball skids through after pitching, and that quicker delivery is just too much for Hetmyer to handle. He's gotta go

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieran Powell run out (Mashrafe Mortaza/Mehidy Hasan Miraz) 4 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: full just outside off, and Hope drives to cover. But this time Powell is already halfway down the wicket with Hope still at the keeper's end. No chance of a single, as Mashrafe collects, lobs the ball to Mehidy, and he wastes no time in whipping the bails off

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rovman Powell not out 74 (41b 5x4 4x6) SR: 180.48

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Rubel Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder c Rubel Hossain b Mustafizur Rahman 9 (10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: full on middle, and he goes for the big shot over extra cover. Can't time it well, and the ball is in the air for ages. Rubel gets under it at long off and does manage to hold on! Sends Holder home.

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 37 runs, 1 wicket)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 168 runs, 3 wickets)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 12.3 overs (76 balls), Extras 5
Over 14.1: Review by West Indies (Bowling), Umpire - JS Wilson, Batsman - Tamim Iqbal (Struck down)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 65/1 in 16.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 37, Shakib Al Hasan 13)
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 56 balls (Tamim Iqbal 25, Shakib Al Hasan 26, Ex 2)
Tamim Iqbal: 50 off 66 balls (4 x 4)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 22.1 overs (134 balls), Extras 6
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 30.5 overs (186 balls), Extras 10
Drinks: Bangladesh - 169/3 in 34.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 88, Mahmudullah 11)
Tamim Iqbal: 100 off 120 balls (7 x 4, 2 x 6)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 38.4 overs (233 balls), Extras 12
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 96 runs, 2 wickets)
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 44.5 overs (270 balls), Extras 12
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 36 balls (Mahmudullah 16, Mashrafe Mortaza 34, Ex 0)
Mahmudullah: 50 off 44 balls (4 x 4, 2 x 6)
Bangladesh: 300 runs in 49.6 overs (301 balls), Extras 13
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 301/6 in 50.0 overs (Mahmudullah 67, Mosaddek Hossain 11)
West Indies innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 53 runs, 0 wicket)
Over 7.5: Review by Bangladesh (Bowling), Umpire - S Ravi, Batsman - CH Gayle (Struck down)
West Indies: 50 runs in 8.6 overs (54 balls), Extras 4
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 54 balls (CH Gayle 35, E Lewis 12, Ex 4)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 140 runs, 4 wickets)
CH Gayle: 50 off 40 balls (5 x 4, 3 x 6)
Drinks: West Indies - 82/1 in 16.0 overs (CH Gayle 55, SD Hope 9)
West Indies: 100 runs in 18.3 overs (111 balls), Extras 5
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 60 balls (CH Gayle 38, SD Hope 12, Ex 0)
West Indies: 150 runs in 31.3 overs (189 balls), Extras 7
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 65 balls (SD Hope 24, SO Hetmyer 24, Ex 2)
Drinks: West Indies - 163/2 in 34.0 overs (SD Hope 42, SO Hetmyer 28)
SD Hope: 50 off 77 balls (4 x 4)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 90 runs, 2 wickets)
West Indies: 200 runs in 40.5 overs (245 balls), Extras 9
West Indies: 250 runs in 45.5 overs (275 balls), Extras 10
R Powell: 50 off 27 balls (3 x 4, 3 x 6)

milestones.description: Chris Gayle has scored 71 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for WI breaking Brian Lara's record
Mortaza has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (188) for BAN, going past Shakib

stories.title: Five questions Bangladesh need to answer
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh in West Indies 2018
stories.seoTitle: Five questions Bangladesh need to answer
stories.summary: Bangladesh bounced back from a poor Test series with a 2-1 ODI win, but they will need to plug a few holes over the course of 10 packed months leading up to the 2019 World Cup

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza finds something interesting to look at
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza finds something interesting to look at, Basseterre, July 27, 2018

stories.title: Bangladesh still have room for improvement, says Mashrafe Mortaza
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, St Kitts
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh still have room for improvement, says Mashrafe Mortaza
stories.summary: While he said the series win was a good sign ahead of the Asia Cup, Bangladesh's ODI captain felt the team had finished '20-25 runs' short in the third ODI in St Kitts

image.caption: Bangladesh's players celebrate their 2-1 series win
image.longCaption: Bangladesh's players celebrate their 2-1 series win, West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Basseterre, July 28, 2018

stories.title: Tamim, Mahmudullah set up series win for Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Basseterre
stories.seoTitle: Tamim Iqbal, Mahmudullah set up series win for Bangladesh
stories.summary: Chris Gayle and Rovman Powell went berserk at the start and end of West Indies' chase respectively, but the visitors held on for a 2-1 margin

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal celebrates his 11th ODI hundred
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal celebrates his 11th ODI hundred, West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Basseterre, July 28, 2018

stories.title: Russell injury hits West Indies ahead of series decider
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Basseterre
stories.seoTitle: Andre Russell injury hits West Indies ahead of series decider
stories.summary: While the momentum is with the hosts, concerns remain, which could possibly deny them their first bilateral ODI series win in four years

image.caption: Jason Holder exults after West Indies' last-over win
image.longCaption: Jason Holder exults after West Indies' last-over win, West Indies v Bangladesh, 2nd ODI, Guyana, July 25, 2018
